fromJSON

public static <T> T fromJSON(java.lang.String value,
                             org.codehaus.jackson.type.TypeReference<T> type)
Converts the JSON string to a typed object via a TypeReference The main complication is handling of Generic types: if they are used, one has to use TypeReference object, to work around Java Type Erasure. ex: return JSONUtils.fromJSON(this.answersJson, new TypeReference>(){});

fromJSON

                             java.lang.Class<T> type)
Converts the JSON string to a typed object (or Map/List if Object.class is passed in)
